#cloud-config
users:
 - default
 - name: cloudy
   sudo: ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL
   ssh-authorized-keys:
    - ssh-rsa  admin@dcim
   homedir: /home/cloudy
   shell: /bin/bash
 - name: admin
   sudo: ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL
   ssh-authorized-keys:
    - ssh-rsa  admin@dcim
   homedir: /home/admin
   shell: /bin/bash
ssh_authorized_keys:
ssh_authorized_keys:
 - ssh-rsa  admin@dcim
 - ssh-rsa  ubuntu@conrtoller2
write_files:
 - content: this is a clou-init write file test...
   owner: root:root
   path: /home/cloudy/.bashrc
   permissions: '0644'
final_message: "The system is finally up, after $UPTIME seconds"
bootcmd:
 - echo 127.0.0.1 $HOSTNAME > /home/cloudy/testfile
